results.title: Velocity stock footage
results.brief_description: Using 16mm filmed sequences of motion through different urban and natural spaces, this footage will create a sense of vertigo and velocity across different planes of movement; through space as experienced via car or foot; above space as experienced through elevators and mechanical escalation and across space as experienced via train and so forth. Across different passages of time and space “day, night, city, underground, suburban, rural, alleyway and so forth” the material will imaginatively explore the way a viewing experience can defy human motion and create a dizzying, disorienting but at all times wondrous and alluring moving image experience.

results.title: Velocity of chemical reactions
results.brief_description: The following points are dealt with: the influence of temperature and the nature of reactants; molecular changes; catalysis and its practical applications; reversible reactions and chemical equilibrium; industrial applications of reactions processes.

results.title: Velocity and acceleration
results.brief_description: Defines motion and explains the concepts of velocity and acceleration. Shows the difference between speed and velocity. Illustrates the positive and negative acceleration due to the force of gravity.

results.title: Velo nero = Black veil
results.brief_description: Serafina had not seen her husband for 5 years. He’d emigrated to Australia to build a new life for himself and his young bride and prepares for Serafina’s eventual arrival as a new Australian. Shortly after receiving her ticket to Australia, Serafina’s husband unexpectedly dies. Alone and in an unfamiliar country, Serafina struggles with the culture, language, social isolation and her grief. An unexpected friendship with Angelo, a young Anglo-Italian, provides the start of happier introduction to a new life. Written by Monica Pellizzari.

results.title: Velazquez
results.brief_description: Gives historical background and critical evaluation of some of Velazquez major works. Shows some of his religious paintings; court portraits of Phillip IV and members of the Spanish Royal Family; informal poses of Cardinal Infante Fernando, Prince Baltasar Carlos as well as jesters of the Royal Court. Photographed at the Prado Museum, Madrid.

results.title: Vectoria
results.brief_description: Presents a story about a skilled pinball player and his experiences with an unusual pinball machine which demonstraters the four dimensions - position, two-dimensional motion, three-dimensional motion, and time. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: VD? See your doctor
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, James McCormick and Karl Konnery
results.brief_description: A straightforward presentation of the cause, symptoms and danger of venereal disease, with strong emphasis on the need to obtain early medical treatment. Although venereal disease, syphilis and gonorrhea, should be extinct in this scientific age, there is an alarming increase in their incidence.

results.title: VD: prevent it
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that although venereal diseases are the easiest to prevent there are more cases of venereal disease than all other communicable diseases combined. The two types of venereal disease and their long-range effects if untreated are described. Regular physical examinations for the sexually active persons are recommended and the role of sexual promiscuity in spreading VD is discussed.

results.title: VD: old bugs new problems
results.brief_description: The term sexually transmitted diseases instead of venereal diseases is now being used by health officials because there are many that are passed from one person to another through sexual contact but not always. Outlines how these diseases are contracted and describes the symptoms of Gonorrhoea, Herpes simplex, Non-gonococcal urethritis, Syphilis, Trichomoniasis, monilia, Venereal warts, Crabs and Scabies.
